fieldGroup.template:
Please describe the recruitment process: submission of the project and obtaining consent from the source subject and/or their legal representative according to the following scheme:

  • who (person/s in charge)
  • how (conversation, video, brochure...)
  • where (place of information and document signing)
  • when they are going to be carried out (time at which they are carried out; for example: when the participating person attends).

'Recruitment process' is understood as all those actions aimed at recruiting people who will participate in the study as research subjects.

This process includes informing the potential participant, convincing them and subsequently obtaining and signing consent.

The recruitment process follows the definition of the sample with the inclusion and exclusion criteria when making the methodological design.

The recruitment process is an essential part of research because it directly affects ethical aspects such as voluntary nature, equity and respect.

options.message: This must be later than the project start date (assessment application general details)

fieldGroup.template:
Note: Add in section '5.7 Additional documentation' all the documents that will be used to recruit study subjects (for example advertisements, brochures, etc., with the full text).

If the process is going to be carried out outside the university facilities, add in section '5.3' the Authorisation Document of the centre or premises (hospitals, educational centres, health centres, etc.).

Please remember that the project cannot be started without having obtained a favourable report of the committee; therefore, the dates should be consistent. The start date of recruitment cannot be earlier than the date when favourable report is issued.
